page.title: 08THE FISHERMEN'S CHAPEL
page.content: We have visited the Fishermen's chapel at St. Brelade's Church. We met Reverend Halliwell and he showed us around. He told us about the history of the chapel, which was built about the 10th. century, before the Domesday book had been written. At the moment the roof is being repaired and we could not go inside. The chapel used to be the church, but now it stands alongside the present church, parts of which also date from Norman times. We were shown the 'perquage' path down which anyone who wished sanctuary from the law could walk to the sea and make an escape, all under the protection of the church. Each of the parish churches in Jersey had a perquage path and, although they can no longer be used for their original purpose, they are the subject of much local folklore and interest.
